definition: special detachment/commando/an armed secret agent squad
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc
(of sth) to move/to set in movement/to displace/to touch/to make use of/to stir (emotions)/to alter/abbr. for 動詞|动词[dong4 ci2], verb

sentences.english: The team's field headquarters that night would be an empty building on the very edge of town.
sentences.chinese: 别动队当晚的战地指挥部就设在城边的一座空楼里。

sentences.english: The Legion was split into special mission groups, often to supplement other clone missions.
sentences.chinese: 兵团被划分为若干别动队，经常增援其他克隆人部队。

sentences.english: In 1938 he issued instructions codifying the role of the SS-VT.
sentences.chinese: 1938年他亲自为党卫队别动队制定了合法的地位。

sentences.english: Power Rangers Blue Ranger light of new voices.
sentences.chinese: 电力别动队蓝色声音游侠光新。

sentences.english: He was also named an honorary member of the United States Army Rangers as a result.
sentences.chinese: 他还任命为美国陆军别动队荣誉成员作为一个结果。

definition: the Kempeitai or Japanese Military Police 1881-1945 (Japanese counterpart of the Gestapo during WWII)
